content: Hi, everyone. If you are signed up and/or interested in working on the International Patient Summary this weekend please make sure that you are registered and indicate that in the ConMan tool. It would be good to indicate that by posting here, too, as we're rather distributed (and many of us are wearing multiple hats) and communicating here will help us keep track and follow our progress.
@Rob Hausam has anyone looked at comparing IPS to Argonaut?

It's on our agenda for this week. We haven't done the detailed comparison yet, though. If you have suggestions for the best way to do that, that would be welcome. I'm behind on actually engaging with Argonaut folks, too (of course I do know a few of them that I can talk with).
so I presume you mean DSTU2 to R4?
let's talk about where that leaves is and what we might be able to do (assuming there is something we can do)

If it's of interest, I've put the IPS onto our development server as a ValueSet. So you could look up the members of that and - for example - filter to just the ones that contain 'hernia' using: https://dev-fhir.snomedtools.org/fhir/ValueSet/ips/$expand?filter=hernia any questions you're welcome to see me at the Terminology Services table.

I was asked how that was defined internally as a FHIR Resource. We used the SNOMED ECL expression for "memberOf" a reference set. See here: https://gist.github.com/pgwilliams/f9a51007e02870b4f5f2010ad4266f31 I've done this example using the GPS because that SNOMED Identifier has been published officially.
Just a reminder to everyone on this track to send me a brief note of what you have done and are doing for the track report. Thanks!
Connectathon 25 and the IPS track are about to begin a few hours from now! For our Connectathon-related communications this time we will be using the IPS stream (and not this topic).
We are planning to hold an IPS Track Orientation session for Connectathon 26 on Wednesday at 11:00 AM EST / 16:00 UTC / 17:00 CET. The details are here.
